newsitem.title: UK: City Centre buys 90 pct of restaurant group.
newsitem.headline: City Centre buys 90 pct of restaurant group.

text.p: UK restaurant group City Centre Restaurant Plc said on Friday that it had agreed to purchase 90 percent of Est Est Est Restaurants Ltd (EEERL) for an initial consideration of around 12.75 million stg.

EEERL operates 13 restaurants, mainly in the northwest of England, comprising nine upmarket Italian restaurants trading as "Est Est Est", three mid-market restaurants trading as "What's Cooking" and one wine bar.

City Centre said in a statement it had agreed to buy the stake from institutional funds managed by Murray Johnstone Private Equity Ltd and from private individuals. The remaining 10 percent will initially continue to be held by Derek Lilley and his wife who remain joint managing directors of EEERL.
City Centre, which owns the Deep Pan Pizza and Garfunkels chains in Britain, said it intends to develop the "Est Est Est" name as a significant brand.
